io.github.rowak.nanoleafapi

Class NanoleafGroup

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.rowak.nanoleafapi.NanoleafGroup

  • public class NanoleafGroup
extends java.lang.Object
    This class simplifies the interface for controlling multiple devices together.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      NanoleafGroup()
      Creates a new empty group.
      NanoleafGroup(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,NanoleafDevice> devices)
      Creates a new group from a set of existing devices.

    • Constructor Detail

      • NanoleafGroup

        public NanoleafGroup()
        Creates a new empty group. This operation is not networked.

      • NanoleafGroup

        public NanoleafGroup(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,NanoleafDevice> devices)
        Creates a new group from a set of existing devices. This operation is not networked.
        Parameters:
        devices - a map containing devices mapped to their unique names

    • Method Detail

      • addDevice

        public void addDevice(java.lang.String name,
                      NanoleafDevice device)
        Adds a device to the group.
        Parameters:
        name - a unique name for the device
        device - the device to add

      • addDevices

        public void addDevices(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,NanoleafDevice> devices)
        Adds a set of devices to the group.
        Parameters:
        devices - the devices to add

      • removeDevice

        public void removeDevice(java.lang.String name)
        Removes a device from the group.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the device to remove

      • getDevices

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,NanoleafDevice> getDevices()
        Gets the set of devices in the group.
        Returns:
        the group devices

      • closeAsyncForAll

        public void closeAsyncForAll()
        Force a shutdown of the internal HTTP client. Note: This method only has effect if asynchronous calls have been made. The HTTP client will eventually shut down on its own, but the application will likely hang until it does (unless this method is called).

      • closeEventListeners

        public void closeEventListeners()
        Closes all event listeners.

      • identify

        public void identify()
              throws NanoleafException,
                     java.io.IOException
        Causes the panels to flash in unison. This is typically used to help users differentiate between multiple panels.
        Throws:
        NanoleafException - If the access token is invalid
        java.io.IOException - If an HTTP exception occurs

      • identifyAsync

        public void identifyAsync(NanoleafCallback<java.lang.String> callback)

        Asynchronously causes the panels to flash in unison. This is typically used to help users differentiate between multiple panels.

        The callback status will return NanoleafCallback.SUCCESS on success, or NanoleafCallback.UNAUTHORIZED if the access token is invalid. If an internal API error occurs, it will instead return NanoleafCallback.FAILURE.

        Parameters:
        callback - called when the identify animation begins or when an error occurs

      • setOn

        public void setOn(boolean on)
           throws NanoleafException,
                  java.io.IOException
        Sets the on state of each device (true = on, false = off).
        Parameters:
        on - whether the devices should be turned on or off
        Throws:
        NanoleafException - If the access token is invalid
        java.io.IOException - If an HTTP exception occurs

      • setOnAsync

        public void setOnAsync(boolean on,
                       NanoleafCallback<java.lang.String> callback)

        Asynchronously sets the on state of each device (true = on, false = off).

        The callback status will return NanoleafCallback.SUCCESS on success, or NanoleafCallback.UNAUTHORIZED if the access token is invalid. If an internal API error occurs, it will instead return NanoleafCallback.FAILURE.

        Parameters:
        on - whether the devices should be turned on or off
        callback - called when the devices changes power state or when an error occurs

      • toggleOn

        public void toggleOn()
              throws NanoleafException,
                     java.io.IOException
        Toggles the on state of each device (on = off, off = on).
        Throws:
        NanoleafException - If the access token is invalid
        java.io.IOException - If an HTTP exception occurs

      • toggleOnAsync

        public void toggleOnAsync(NanoleafCallback<java.lang.Boolean> callback)
                   throws NanoleafException,
                          java.io.IOException

        Toggles the on state of each device (on = off, off = on).

        The callback status will return NanoleafCallback.SUCCESS on success, or NanoleafCallback.UNAUTHORIZED if the access token is invalid. If an internal API error occurs, it will instead return NanoleafCallback.FAILURE.

        Parameters:
        callback - called when the the devices changes power state or if error occurs
        Throws:
        NanoleafException - If the access token is invalid
        java.io.IOException - If an HTTP exception occurs

      • setBrightness

        public void setBrightness(int brightness)
                   throws NanoleafException,
                          java.io.IOException
        Sets the master brightness of the device.
        Parameters:
        brightness - the new brightness level as a percent
        Throws:
        NanoleafException - If the access token is invalid, or the specified brightness is not between 0 and 100 (inclusive)
        java.io.IOException - If an HTTP exception occurs

      • setBrightnessAsync

        public void setBrightnessAsync(int brightness,
                               NanoleafCallback<java.lang.String> callback)

        Asynchronously sets the master brightness of the device.

        The callback status will return NanoleafCallback.SUCCESS on success, or NanoleafCallback.UNAUTHORIZED if the access token is invalid. If an internal API error occurs, it will instead return NanoleafCallback.FAILURE.

        Parameters:
        brightness - the new brightness level as a percent
        callback - called when the brightness is changed or when an error occurs

      • fadeToBrightness

        public void fadeToBrightness(int brightness,
                             int duration)
                      throws NanoleafException,
                             java.io.IOException

        Fades the master brightness of the devices over a period of time.

        Note: the fade itself is not synchronous, only the request being made. This means that the calling thread will not hang during the fade.

        Parameters:
        brightness - the new brightness level as a percent
        duration - the fade time, in seconds
        Throws:
        NanoleafException - If the access token is invalid, or the specified brightness is not between 0 and 100 (inclusive)
        java.io.IOException - If an HTTP exception occurs

      • fadeToBrightnessAsync

        public void fadeToBrightnessAsync(int brightness,
                                  int duration,
                                  NanoleafCallback<java.lang.String> callback)

        Asynchronously fades the master brightness of the devices over a period of time.

        The callback status will return NanoleafCallback.SUCCESS on success, or NanoleafCallback.UNAUTHORIZED if the access token is invalid. If an internal API error occurs, it will instead return NanoleafCallback.FAILURE.

        Parameters:
        brightness - the new brightness level as a percent
        duration - the fade time, in seconds
        callback - called when the fade begins or when an error occurs

        The callback status will return NanoleafCallback.SUCCESS on success, or NanoleafCallback.UNAUTHORIZED if the access token is invalid. If an internal API error occurs, it will instead return NanoleafCallback.FAILURE.

        Parameters:

      • setHue

        public void setHue(int hue)
            throws NanoleafException,
                   java.io.IOException
        Sets the hue of the devices (static/custom effects only).
        Parameters:
        hue - the new hue
        Throws:
        NanoleafException - If the access token is invalid, or the specified hue is not between 0 and 360 (inclusive).
        java.io.IOException - If an HTTP exception occurs

      • setHueAsync

        public void setHueAsync(int hue,
                        NanoleafCallback<java.lang.String> callback)

        Asynchronously sets the hue of the devices (static/custom effects only).

        The callback status will return NanoleafCallback.SUCCESS on success, or NanoleafCallback.UNAUTHORIZED if the access token is invalid. If an internal API error occurs, it will instead return NanoleafCallback.FAILURE.

        Parameters:
        hue - the new hue
        callback - called when the hue changes or when an error occurs

      • increaseHue

        public void increaseHue(int amount)
                 throws NanoleafException,
                        java.io.IOException
        Increases the hue by a set amount.
        Parameters:
        amount - the amount to increase by
        Throws:
        NanoleafException - If the access token is invalid
        java.io.IOException - If an HTTP exception occurs

      • increaseHueAsync

        public void increaseHueAsync(int amount,
                             NanoleafCallback<java.lang.String> callback)

        Asynchronously increases the hue by a set amount.

        The callback status will return NanoleafCallback.SUCCESS on success, or NanoleafCallback.UNAUTHORIZED if the access token is invalid. If an internal API error occurs, it will instead return NanoleafCallback.FAILURE. The returned data will never be meaningful (either an empty string or null).

        Parameters:
        amount - the amount to increase by
        callback - called when the hue changes or when an error occurs

      • decreaseHue

        public void decreaseHue(int amount)
                 throws NanoleafException,
                        java.io.IOException
        Decreases the hue by a set amount.
        Parameters:
        amount - the amount to decrease by
        Throws:
        NanoleafException - If the access token is invalid
        java.io.IOException - If an HTTP exception occurs

      • decreaseHueAsync

        public void decreaseHueAsync(int amount,
                             NanoleafCallback<java.lang.String> callback)

        Asynchronously decreases the hue by a set amount.

        The callback status will return NanoleafCallback.SUCCESS on success, or NanoleafCallback.UNAUTHORIZED if the access token is invalid. If an internal API error occurs, it will instead return NanoleafCallback.FAILURE. The returned data will never be meaningful (either an empty string or null).

        Parameters:
        amount - the amount to decrease by
        callback - called when the brightness changes or when an error occurs

                               NanoleafCallback<java.lang.String> callback)

        Asynchronously sets the saturation of the devices (static/custom effects only).

        The callback status will return NanoleafCallback.SUCCESS on success, or NanoleafCallback.UNAUTHORIZED if the access token is invalid. If an internal API error occurs, it will instead return NanoleafCallback.FAILURE. The returned data will never be meaningful (either an empty string or null).

        Parameters:
        saturation - the new saturation
        callback - called when the saturation is set or when an error occurs

        public void setColorTemperature(int colorTemperature)
                         throws NanoleafException,
                                java.io.IOException
        Sets the color temperature of the devices in Kelvin.
        Parameters:
        colorTemperature - color temperature in Kelvin
        Throws:
        NanoleafException - If the access token is invalid, or the specified color temperature is not between 1200 and 6500 (inclusive)
        java.io.IOException - If an HTTP exception occurs

      • setColorTemperatureAsync

        public void setColorTemperatureAsync(int colorTemperature,
                                     NanoleafCallback<java.lang.String> callback)

        Asynchronously sets the color temperature of the devices in Kelvin.

        The callback status will return NanoleafCallback.SUCCESS on success, or NanoleafCallback.UNAUTHORIZED if the access token is invalid. If an internal API error occurs, it will instead return NanoleafCallback.FAILURE. The returned data will never be meaningful (either an empty string or null).

        Parameters:
        colorTemperature - color temperature in Kelvin
        callback - called when the color temperature changes or when an error occurs

        java.io.IOException - If an HTTP exception occurs

      • increaseColorTemperatureAsync

        public void increaseColorTemperatureAsync(int amount,
                                          NanoleafCallback<java.lang.String> callback)

        Asynchronously increases the color temperature by a set amount.

        The callback status will return NanoleafCallback.SUCCESS on success, or NanoleafCallback.UNAUTHORIZED if the access token is invalid. If an internal API error occurs, it will instead return NanoleafCallback.FAILURE. The returned data will never be meaningful (either an empty string or null).

        Parameters:
        amount - the amount to increase by
        callback - called when the color temperature changes or when an error occurs

      • decreaseColorTemperature

                              throws NanoleafException,

        Throws:
        NanoleafException - If the access token is invalid

               throws NanoleafException,
                      java.io.IOException

        java.io.IOException - If an HTTP exception occurs

        public void addEffectAsync(Effect effect,
                           NanoleafCallback<java.lang.String> callback)

        Asynchronously uploads and installs an effect to the devices. If the effect does not exist on the devices it will be created. If the effect exists it will be overwritten.

        The callback status will return NanoleafCallback.SUCCESS on success, or NanoleafCallback.UNAUTHORIZED if the access token is invalid, or NanoleafCallback.UNPROCESSABLE_ENTITY/NanoleafCallback.BAD_REQUEST if the effect is invalid. If an internal API error occurs, it will instead return NanoleafCallback.FAILURE. The returned data will never be meaningful (either an empty string or null).

        Parameters:
        effect - the effect to be uploaded
        callback - called when the effect is added or when an error occurs

      • setPanelColor

        public void setPanelColor(Panel panel,
                          int red,
                          int green,
                          int blue,
                          int transitionTime)
                   throws NanoleafException,
                          java.io.IOException
        Sets the color of a single panel on the device.
        Parameters:
        panel - the target panel
        red - the red RGB value
        green - the green RGB value
        blue - the blue RGB value
        transitionTime - the time to transition to this frame from the previous frame (must be 1 or greater)
        Throws:
        NanoleafException - If the access token is invalid, or the specified panel does not exist, or the RGB values are invalid (must be 0 < x < 255)
        java.io.IOException - If an HTTP exception occurs

      • setPanelColorAsync

        public void setPanelColorAsync(Panel panel,
                               int red,
                               int green,
                               int blue,
                               int transitionTime,
                               NanoleafCallback<java.lang.String> callback)

        Asynchronously sets the color of a single panel on the device.

        The callback status will return NanoleafCallback.SUCCESS on success, or NanoleafCallback.UNAUTHORIZED if the access token is invalid, or NanoleafCallback.UNPROCESSABLE_ENTITY/NanoleafCallback.BAD_REQUEST if the color is invalid. If an internal API error occurs, it will instead return NanoleafCallback.FAILURE. The returned data will never be meaningful (either an empty string or null).

        Parameters:
        panel - the target panel
        red - the red RGB value
        green - the green RGB value
        blue - the blue RGB value
        transitionTime - the time to transition to this frame from the previous frame (must be 1 or greater)
        callback - called when the panel changes color or when an error occurs

      • fadeToColor

        public void fadeToColor(int red,
                        int green,
                        int blue,
                        int duration)
                 throws NanoleafException,
                        java.io.IOException
        Fades all of the panels to an RGB color over a period of time.
        Parameters:
        red - the red RGB value
        green - the green RGB value
        blue - the blue RGB value
        duration - the fade time, in hertz (10Hz = 1sec)
        Throws:
        NanoleafException - If the access token is invalid, or the RGB values are invalid (must be 0 < x < 255), or the duration is negative
        java.io.IOException - If an HTTP exception occurs

      • fadeToColorAsync

        public void fadeToColorAsync(int red,
                             int green,
                             int blue,
                             int duration,
                             NanoleafCallback<java.lang.String> callback)

        Asynchronously fades all of the panels to an RGB color over a period of time.

        The callback status will return NanoleafCallback.SUCCESS on success, or NanoleafCallback.UNAUTHORIZED if the access token is invalid, or NanoleafCallback.UNPROCESSABLE_ENTITY/NanoleafCallback.BAD_REQUEST if the color/duration are invalid. If an internal API error occurs, it will instead return NanoleafCallback.FAILURE. The returned data will never be meaningful (either an empty string or null).

        Parameters:
        red - the red RGB value
        green - the green RGB value
        blue - the blue RGB value
        duration - the fade time, in hertz (10Hz = 1sec)
        callback - called when the fade starts or when an error occurs

      • writeEffectAsync

        public void writeEffectAsync(java.lang.String command,
                             NanoleafCallback<java.lang.String> callback)

        (This method works with JSON data)

        Asynchronously uploads a JSON string to the devices. Calls the write effect command from the OpenAPI. Refer to it for more information about the commands.

        Commands:

        • add - Installs an effect on the devices or updates the effect if it already exists.
        • delete - Permanently removes an effect from the device.
        • request - Requests a single effect by name.
        • requestAll - Requests all the installed effects from the device.
        • display - Sets a color mode on the devices (used for previewing effects).
        • displayTemp - Temporarily sets a color mode on the devices (typically used for notifications of visual indicators).
        • rename - Changes the name of an effect on the device.

        The callback status will return NanoleafCallback.SUCCESS on success, or NanoleafCallback.UNAUTHORIZED if the access token is invalid, or NanoleafCallback.UNPROCESSABLE_ENTITY/NanoleafCallback.BAD_REQUEST if the effect is invalid. If an internal API error occurs, it will instead return NanoleafCallback.FAILURE. The returned data will never be meaningful (either an empty string or null).

        Parameters:
        command - the operation to perform the write with
        callback - called when the write request completes or when an error occurs

                          throws NanoleafException,
                                 java.io.IOException

        NanoleafException - If the access token is invalid
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O exception occurs
        java.net.SocketException - If the target device cannot be found or connected to

      • setPanelExternalStreamingAsync

        public void setPanelExternalStreamingAsync(int panelId,
                                           Color color,
                                           int transitionTime,
                                           NanoleafCallback<java.lang.String> callback)

        Updates the color of a single panel using external streaming.

        The callback status will return NanoleafCallback.SUCCESS on success, or NanoleafCallback.UNAUTHORIZED if the access token is invalid. If an internal API error occurs, it will instead return NanoleafCallback.FAILURE.

        Parameters:
        panelId - the id of the panel to update
        color - the color object
        transitionTime - the time to transition to this frame from the previous frame (must be 1 or greater)
        callback - called when the panel color changes or when an error occurs

      • setPanelExternalStreaming

                                      Color color,
                                      int transitionTime)
                               throws NanoleafException,
                                      java.io.IOException
